question.text: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>0</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>400</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> of an organic compound <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mo>)</mo></math> gave <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>0</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>376</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>AgBr</mi></math> in Carius method for estimation of bromine. <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>%</mo></math> of bromine in the compound <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>(</mo><mi>X</mi><mo>)</mo></math> is (Given: Molar mass <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>AgBr</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>188</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi>mol</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced open=""><mrow><mi>Br</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>80</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi>mol</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfenced></math>

solution.text:
The percentage composition of element =mass of elementmass of organic compound×100

Moles of AgBr=0.376188

Moles of Br=0.376188

Mass of Br=0.376188×80

% of Br=0.376×80188×(0.400)×100

= 40%
